description.narrative: Children and women in Iraq are protected by a child protection system with stronger legislative, policy, institutional, community structures and capacities to deliver high quality multi-sectoral, age appropriate child protection and GBV services.

mailing-address.narrative: C/o UNICEF Amman P.O. Box 1551 Amman 11821

sector.narrative: Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - planning, co-ordination and programme monitoring

title.narrative: Iraq United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Iraq Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Adolescent Development and Participation)
Iraq Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Child Protection)
Iraq Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Overall)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and women in Iraq are protected by a child protection system with stronger legislative, policy, institutional, community structures and capacities to deliver high quality multi-sectoral, age appropriate child protection and GBV services.
Functional government entity with legal mandate, skilled workforce, inter-operable information management system for child protection exists at Federal, Regional (KRI) and in 10 governorates
# of child protection laws, policies and guidelines developed in line with international standard and endorsed by Federal Government and KRG
Number of children participating in structured and sustained psychosocial support programmes
Number of girls and boys receiving specialized child protection services (reunification, alternative care, case management)
Number of women and girls who received at least one kind of UNICEF supported GBV risk mitigation, prevention or response interventions
Number of boys, girls, men and women reached with social norm change interventions including parenting, adolescent life skills etc.
Number of boys, girls, men and women reached with social norm change interventions including parenting, adolescent life skills etc.
